thread.title: Fasting farm leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal's health condition critical, say doctors
thread.title_full: Fasting farm leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal's health condition critical, say doctors

author: @indiatoday
title: Fasting farm leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal's health condition critical, say doctors
text:
Fasting farm leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal's health condition critical, say doctors
Doctors said that the health condition of Dallewal, is on a hunger strike since November 26, is deteriorating and his "life is hanging by a threat". They said that the farm leader is at the risk of cardiac arrest and multi-organ failure as well.
In Short
- Farm leader Jagit Singh Dallewal is on a 24-day hunger strike
- Dallewal's health is critical with risk of cardiac arrest
- Doctors urge hospitalisation for Dallewal's deteriorating condition
Farm leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, who has been on a hunger strike at Khanauri border for 24 days, became unconscious for around 10 minutes on Thursday after his blood pressure dropped.
Doctors said that the health condition of Dallewal, who is a farm leader from Punjab, is deteriorating and his "life is hanging by a threat". They said that the farm leader is at the risk of cardiac arrest and multi-organ failure as well.
Dallewal has been on a hunger strike at the Khanauri border between Punjab and Haryana since November 26, urging the central government to address the farmers' demands, including a legal guarantee for Minimum Support Price (MSP) on crops.
Earlier on Thursday, the [Supreme Court expressed dissatisfaction with the Punjab government's efforts](https://www.indiatoday.in/india/law-news/story/supreme-court-raps-punjab-over-medical-care-for-fasting-farm-leader-jagjit-dallewal-2652501-2024-12-19) to provide adequate medical care for Dallewal. The court also urged the state to convince Dallewal, who is in his 70s, to shift to a hospital for proper treatment.
The police have converted a hotel near the protest site into a makeshift hospital to offer necessary medical services.
Addressing the media after examining Dallewal, Dr Navraj, who is associated with the Five Rivers NGO, said that Dallewal became unconscious as his blood pressure dropped due to his hunger strike. He was immediately given a massage and treatment, after which he regained consciousness, and is currently in a very critical condition.
Senior Medical Officer of Punjab's Samana, Dr Sanjeev Arora, said that Jagjit Singh Dallewal's health had deteriorated a lot during the day. A medical team from Rajinder Hospital Patiala has reached the spot and is conducting his health check-up, he said.
